title: [FR] Context manager for autologging

body:

**Please fill in this feature request template to ensure a timely and thorough response.**

## Willingness to contribute
The MLflow Community encourages new feature contributions. Would you or another member of your organization be willing to contribute an implementation of this feature (either as an MLflow Plugin or an enhancement to the MLflow code base)?

- [ ] Yes. I can contribute this feature independently.
- [x] Yes. I would be willing to contribute this feature with guidance from the MLflow community.
- [ ] No. I cannot contribute this feature at this time.

## Proposal Summary

Sometimes, it would be handy to deactivate the autologging functionality temporarily. Like this
```python
import mlflow

mlflow.sklearn.autolog() 
# do stuff

with mlflow.sklearn.autolog(disable = True):
    # fit a null model or 
    # do a sklearn transformation not related to the main model
    # ect.
```
Unfortunately, this gives an error. Of course, the workaround is to manually manage the context, but it's brittle and requires more boilerplate code.
```python
import mlflow

mlflow.sklearn.autolog() 
# do stuff

mlflow.sklearn.autolog(disable = True)
# fit a null model or 
# do a sklearn transformation not related to the main model
# ect.

mlflow.sklearn.autolog() 
```


## Motivation
- What is the use case for this feature? Boiler plate reduction and cognitive burden reduction.
- Why is this use case valuable to support for MLflow users in general?
- Why is this use case valuable to support for your project(s) or organization?
- Why is it currently difficult to achieve this use case? More code, remember parameters set before etc.
